pullrequest.title: Update to ignition citadel dependencies, c++17, cmake 3.10

content.raw:
I tried using Fuel with Gazebo 9.11.0 as follows:

1. Change `url` in `~/.ignition/fuel/config.yaml` to `https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org`
1. Open Gazebo with `USE_IGNITION_FUEL=true gazebo --verbose`
1. Wait a long time until the model list is populated on the Insert menu
1. Choose a model to insert. Some of them showed up as the preview that is attached to the mouse, but after I click they disappear.
content.html:
I tried using Fuel with Gazebo 9.11.0 as follows:

  1. Change url in ~/.ignition/fuel/config.yaml to https://fuel.ignitionrobotics.org
  2. Open Gazebo with USE_IGNITION_FUEL=true gazebo --verbose
  3. Wait a long time until the model list is populated on the Insert menu
  4. Choose a model to insert. Some of them showed up as the preview that is attached to the mouse, but after I click they disappear.

pullrequest.title: Update to ignition citadel dependencies, c++17, cmake 3.10

content.raw:
there are some issues with the lack of optional fields in proto3. I will consider reverting the joint controller from `ignition::msgs::JointCmd` to using `gazebo::msgs::JointCmd` since it is still in proto2

we might need to modify `ignition::msgs::JointCmd` if it will use the proto3 syntax
content.html:
there are some issues with the lack of optional fields in proto3. I will consider reverting the joint controller from ignition::msgs::JointCmd to using gazebo::msgs::JointCmd since it is still in proto2

we might need to modify ignition::msgs::JointCmd if it will use the proto3 syntax

pullrequest.title: Update to ignition citadel dependencies, c++17, cmake 3.10

content.raw: there was a linking error with a plugin failing to find `-lgts`, but that should need to be a public library export, so I use the `PRIVATE` keyword in the `target_link_libraries` commands for gazebo_common in df6c4eb
content.html: there was a linking error with a plugin failing to find -lgts, but that should need to be a public library export, so I use the PRIVATE keyword in the target_link_libraries commands for gazebo_common in df6c4eb

pullrequest.title: Update to ignition citadel dependencies, c++17, cmake 3.10

content.raw:
it's now failing to compile with msgs5 due to a removed field from image.proto

* https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/158/remove-deprecations-in-ign-msgs5/diff#Lproto/ignition/msgs/image.protoF67

~~~
gazebo/sensors/CameraSensor.cc: In member function ‘virtual bool gazebo::sensors::CameraSensor::UpdateImpl(bool)’:
gazebo/sensors/CameraSensor.cc:249:11: error: ‘class ignition::msgs::Image’ has no member named ‘set_pixel_format’; did you mean ‘set_pixel_format_type’?
       msg.set_pixel_format(common::Image::ConvertPixelFormat(
           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
           set_pixel_format_type
~~~

we'll need to convert to the ign-msgs enum
content.html:
it's now failing to compile with msgs5 due to a removed field from image.proto

  • https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/158/remove-deprecations-in-ign-msgs5/diff#Lproto/ignition/msgs/image.protoF67
gazebo/sensors/CameraSensor.cc: In member function ‘virtual bool gazebo::sensors::CameraSensor::UpdateImpl(bool)’:
gazebo/sensors/CameraSensor.cc:249:11: error: ‘class ignition::msgs::Image’ has no member named ‘set_pixel_format’; did you mean ‘set_pixel_format_type’?
       msg.set_pixel_format(common::Image::ConvertPixelFormat(
           ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
           set_pixel_format_type

we'll need to convert to the ign-msgs enum

~~~
$ grep -r "HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL" gazebo/
gazebo/gui/InsertModelWidgetPrivate.hh:#ifdef HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL_TOOLS
gazebo/gui/InsertModelWidgetPrivate.hh:#ifdef HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL_TOOLS
gazebo/gui/InsertModelWidgetPrivate.hh:#ifdef HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL_TOOLS
gazebo/gui/InsertModelWidget.cc:#ifdef HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL_TOOLS
gazebo/gui/InsertModelWidget.cc:#ifndef HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL_TOOLS
gazebo/gui/InsertModelWidget.cc:#ifdef HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL_TOOLS
gazebo/gui/InsertModelWidget.cc:#ifdef HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL_TOOLS
gazebo/gui/InsertModelWidget.cc:#ifdef  HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL_TOOLS
~~~
content.html:
HAVE_IGNITION_FUEL_TOOLS is still used in gazebo/gui, did you mean to also remove it from there?

pullrequest.title: Update to ignition citadel dependencies, c++17, cmake 3.10

content.raw:
Done in 88df641

Now `USE_IGNITION_FUEL=true gazebo --verbose` displays the list of models and they can be correctly inserted.

I'm actually wondering if we can remove this env var guard. It was added on pull request #2860. I don't remember exactly why Fuel wasn't "quite ready for end-users yet", I think it was because we used to need to set the `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH` variable like explained on pull request #2800, but I suspect this isn't the case anymore. I can look into this as a separate PR.
content.html:
Done in 88df641

Now USE_IGNITION_FUEL=true gazebo --verbose displays the list of models and they can be correctly inserted.

I'm actually wondering if we can remove this env var guard. It was added on pull request #2860. I don't remember exactly why Fuel wasn't "quite ready for end-users yet", I think it was because we used to need to set the GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH variable like explained on pull request #2800, but I suspect this isn't the case anymore. I can look into this as a separate PR.

pullrequest.title: Update to ignition citadel dependencies, c++17, cmake 3.10

content.raw:
A crash related to SDF:

1. Open model editor
1. Insert 2 simple shapes
1. Create a joint between them: the moment the `Create` button is clicked, `gzclient` crashes with this backtrace:

```
Error [Element.cc:788] Missing element description for [use_parent_model_frame]
[New Thread 0x7fff2ffff700 (LWP 24138)]

Thread 1 "gzclient" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff2953c1f in sdf::v9::Element::Set<bool> (_value=@0x7fffffffc970: false, this=0x0) at /usr/include/c++/8/bits/unique_ptr.h:342
342           get() const noexcept
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff2953c1f in sdf::v9::Element::Set<bool>(bool const&) (_value=@0x7fffffffc970: false, this=0x0) at /usr/include/c++/8/bits/unique_ptr.h:342
#1  0x00007ffff2953c1f in gazebo::msgs::AxisToSDF(gazebo::msgs::Axis const&, std::shared_ptr<sdf::v9::Element>) (_msg=..., _sdf=std::shared_ptr<sdf::v9::Element> (use count 2,
weak count 3) = {...}) at /mnt/TERA/code/gazeboA/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc:3194
#2  0x00007ffff296ebfc in gazebo::msgs::JointToSDF(gazebo::msgs::Joint const&, std::shared_ptr<sdf::v9::Element>) (_msg=..., _sdf=...)
    at /mnt/TERA/code/gazeboA_ws/build/Gazebo/gazebo/msgs/joint.pb.h:1127
#3  0x00007ffff7360382 in gazebo::gui::JointMaker::FinalizeCreation() (this=0x55555a41a750) at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:726
```
content.html:
A crash related to SDF:

  1. Open model editor
  2. Insert 2 simple shapes
  3. Create a joint between them: the moment the Create button is clicked, gzclient crashes with this backtrace:
Error [Element.cc:788] Missing element description for [use_parent_model_frame]
[New Thread 0x7fff2ffff700 (LWP 24138)]

Thread 1 "gzclient" received signal SIGSEGV, Segmentation fault.
0x00007ffff2953c1f in sdf::v9::Element::Set<bool> (_value=@0x7fffffffc970: false, this=0x0) at /usr/include/c++/8/bits/unique_ptr.h:342
342           get() const noexcept
(gdb) bt
#0  0x00007ffff2953c1f in sdf::v9::Element::Set<bool>(bool const&) (_value=@0x7fffffffc970: false, this=0x0) at /usr/include/c++/8/bits/unique_ptr.h:342
#1  0x00007ffff2953c1f in gazebo::msgs::AxisToSDF(gazebo::msgs::Axis const&, std::shared_ptr<sdf::v9::Element>) (_msg=..., _sdf=std::shared_ptr<sdf::v9::Element> (use count 2,
weak count 3) = {...}) at /mnt/TERA/code/gazeboA/gazebo/msgs/msgs.cc:3194
#2  0x00007ffff296ebfc in gazebo::msgs::JointToSDF(gazebo::msgs::Joint const&, std::shared_ptr<sdf::v9::Element>) (_msg=..., _sdf=...)
    at /mnt/TERA/code/gazeboA_ws/build/Gazebo/gazebo/msgs/joint.pb.h:1127
#3  0x00007ffff7360382 in gazebo::gui::JointMaker::FinalizeCreation() (this=0x55555a41a750) at /usr/include/boost/smart_ptr/shared_ptr.hpp:726

pullrequest.title: Update to ignition citadel dependencies, c++17, cmake 3.10

content.raw:
I'm running into a weird issue on this branch related to `GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH`. When I try to load a model that's not from `gazebo_models`, but is on the path, `gzclient` is able to load it but `gzserver` isn't. `SystemPaths::FindFileURI` is not looking at the extra paths for some reason, but it's not clear to me why yet. 

I just checked that it works well on `default`, so the problem is definitely introduced by this PR. I'm looking into it.
content.html:
I'm running into a weird issue on this branch related to GAZEBO_MODEL_PATH. When I try to load a model that's not from gazebo_models, but is on the path, gzclient is able to load it but gzserver isn't. SystemPaths::FindFileURI is not looking at the extra paths for some reason, but it's not clear to me why yet.

I just checked that it works well on default, so the problem is definitely introduced by this PR. I'm looking into it.

pullrequest.title: Update to ignition citadel dependencies, c++17, cmake 3.10

content.raw:
there was some undefined behavior regarding the initialization of the static `PathDelimiter` variable in `SystemPaths`. In [branch citadel_deps_msgs_system_paths_initialization](#!/osrf/gazebo/branch/citadel_deps_msgs_system_paths_initialization?dest=citadel_deps_msgs#diff), I've fixed that bug and also another bug in the delimited string parsing

I'll merge that branch directly into this one if it looks good to you

* #!/osrf/gazebo/branch/citadel_deps_msgs_system_paths_initialization?dest=citadel_deps_msgs#diff
content.html:
there was some undefined behavior regarding the initialization of the static PathDelimiter variable in SystemPaths. In branch citadel_deps_msgs_system_paths_initialization, I've fixed that bug and also another bug in the delimited string parsing

I'll merge that branch directly into this one if it looks good to you
